title: Las Vegas is on the clock! Reid's updated NFL mock draft predicts picks 1-32
content: Which QB fits with the Raiders at No. 1? How high could Jeremiyah Love go? Will the Buckeyes run the first round? Let's project the first 32 picks for April.

title: Draft order for Round 1: The first 18 slots are set, and the Raiders will pick at No. 1
content: The Raiders, Jets and Cardinals hold the top three picks in the 2026 NFL draft. See the rest of the order.

title: Sources: OC Weis to coach Ole Miss in CFP semi
content: LSU is allowing OC Charlie Weis Jr. and RBs coach Kevin Smith to stay with Ole Miss to coach in the Fiesta Bowl, sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: KD savors winner vs. Suns after being 'kicked out'
content: Rockets star Kevin Durant said hitting the winning shot Monday night against the Suns meant more because it came against his former team, one "that booted you out of the building and scapegoated you for all the problems they had."

title: Sources: RB Lacy signs new deal with Ole Miss
content: Ole Miss star running back Kewan Lacy signed a deal to return for the Rebels in 2026, sources told ESPN on Monday.

title: Day after Huskers pledge, QB Minchey flips to UK
content: One day after announcing his commitment to Nebraska, transfer quarterback Kenny Minchey, the former Notre Dame backup, has flipped to Kentucky, he told ESPN on Monday.

title: Drubbed in Detroit, skidding Knicks seek answers
content: The Knicks agreed that "a lot needs to be addressed" after a blowout loss to the East-leading Pistons, New York's fourth straight defeat.

title: Chelsea names Rosenior coach on 5+-year deal
content: Chelsea have announced the appointment of Liam Rosenior as their new head coach on a 5 ½-year contract.

title: Sources: Hawks, Young working together on trade
content: Atlanta Hawks four-time All-Star Trae Young and his agent, Aaron Mintz, are working with the franchise on a trade, sources told ESPN.

title: Kerr ejected, Curry fouls out as calls rile Warriors
content: Warriors coach Steve Kerr was ejected from his team's 103-102 loss to the Clippers in the fourth quarter Monday night after a string of officiating decisions set him off on the sideline. Stephen Curry also fouled out for the first time since 2021.

title: Montana St. tops Illinois St. in wild FCS title game
content: Montana State won its first national championship since 1984 in Monday's first OT in FCS title game history.

title: Best fits for Bucks, Lakers and top contending teams
content: One month from the NBA trade deadline, which top contending teams could make a move for a potential playoff push?

title: Four trade proposals for Trae Young: What could Atlanta get for the star guard?
content: Young could become the NBA trade season's first domino. Let's help the Hawks find the best move for the  guard.

title: Let's play myth-busters for the NFL playoffs: 14 teams, 14 things that aren't quite right
content: The Packers need a WR1? The Broncos can't keep winning tight games? The Pats' run defense and the Seahawks' run offense are problems? We're not so sure.

title: Our latest MLB offseason intel: Which top free agent will sign next? Is a blockbuster trade brewing?
content: Here's what we're hearing about Ketel Marte, Alex Bregman, Bo Bichette and much more as the hot stove heats back up.

title: Why Matthew Stafford's command of the huddle gives Rams an edge
content: Ahead of Saturday's playoff game, the Rams quarterback's demeanor and football IQ renders him a unique signal-caller.

title: 'Fragile' no more: How the Bears' Caleb Williams, Ben Johnson evolved
content: Williams thought Johnson didn't like him at one point, but the duo evolved to lead the playoff-bound Bears.

title: Who will be Man United's next manager? 12 top candidates to replace Amorim
content: Whether Manchester United aim to hire quickly or wait until summer, here are the coaches they could be after.

title: Barnwell makes his NFL award picks: Ranking candidates for MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Drake Maye or Matthew Stafford for MVP? Which rookies should earn hardware? And no one is beating out Myles Garrett for DPOY, right?

title: MVP, ROY, All-NBA teams and more: Predictions for all the league's highest honors
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton projects the favorites to win each award and make the All-NBA teams, as well as other contenders and long shots.

title: Browns in full reset mode: Here's what we know after ouster of Kevin Stefanski
content: In search of a new coach, Cleveland enters an offseason with first-round picks and unsettled questions at QB.

title: Supercopa de España: Can Real Madrid, Atletico or Athletic stop Barça?
content: Here's all you need to know about the 2026 Supercopa de España, with Barcelona, Real Madrid, Atlético Madrid and Athletic Club vying for the crown this week.

title: Who should be Spain's No.1 at the World Cup: Joan García or Unaí Simon?
content: García's star turn is the latest sign that Spain might have a genuine goalkeeping battle on their hands.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Michigan State, Kansas stumble
content: Nebraska cracks the top 10. SMU and UCF replace Florida and USC. See more changes after the two-week hiatus.

title: SC Next Top 25: The best high school boys' basketball teams in 2025-26
content: Link Academy (Miss.) takes the No. 1 spot to start the calendar year, with Spire Academy (Ohio) making the biggest jump to No. 2 in January.

title: SC Next Top 25: The best high school girls' basketball teams in 2025-26
content: Ontario Christian (Calif.) stays atop the 2025-26 SC Next girls' high school rankings as the showcase of the month is the Hoophall Classic.

title: CFP semifinals first look: Previewing the penultimate round
content: How each team can win its semifinal game, plus key players and what we learned from the quarterfinals.

title: Pro wrestling awards 2025: Dominik Mysterio, Stephanie Vaquer and an AEW resurgence
content: Pro wrestling insiders identify their top stars and biggest moments of 2025 in WWE, AEW and other top promotions.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Éderson; could Rashford return?
content: Man United have reportedly inquired about Atalanta midfielder Éderson, and does Marcus Rashford have a route back to the club? Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Make these fights, UFC: Makhachev-Topuria, Jones-Pereira and more
content: From superfights to title rematches to downright epics, these 10 matchups need to be booked this year.

title: Boxing's best of 2025: Fighters, fights, KO, upset and more
content: Terence Crawford, Gabriela Fundora, Rolando "Rolly" Romero and others were part of the best boxing moments of 2025.

title: 'Will Trump kidnap PM?' Chavan's bizarre remark amid Venezuela crisis; BJP hits back
content: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan linked US trade tensions and tariffs on India to the alleged CIA-led operation in Venezuela, questioning if President Trump would kidnap India's Prime Minister. He criticised the government's silence on Venezuela and its perceived fear of the US, highlighting India's need to find alternative export markets due to the 50% US tariff.

title: ‘Dad I tell you …’: Nicolas Maduro's son sends defiant message, gets emotional - watch
content: Venezuelan lawmaker Nicolas Maduro Guerra delivered an emotional plea in the national assembly following his father President Maduro's capture by US forces. He pledged loyalty to interim President Delcy Rodríguez and expressed hope for his father's swift return.  Maduro, facing drug trafficking charges in New York, declared himself 'still the leader of Venezuela,' intensifying regional tensions.

title: Noida marriage row: Woman alleges husband hid baldness despite ‘thick hair’ promise
content: A Noida woman has filed a police case against her husband and in-laws, alleging deception regarding his appearance, education, and income. The bride claims her husband, Sanyam Jain, misled her about being bald and also threatened her with private photos and physical assault. She further accused him of pressuring her to smuggle marijuana from Thailand.

title: Sigh of relief? ISL to resume on Feb 14, sports minister confirms
content: "There was lot of speculation regarding ISL but today the government, football federation and 14 clubs, Mohun Bagan and East Bengal included had a meeting and we have decided that ISL will start February 14. All clubs will participate," Mandaviya said.

title: Greenland row: European leaders push back on Trump's threat of US takeover
content: European leaders, including Denmark's Prime Minister, jointly stated that Greenland "belongs to its people," pushing back against US President Trump's threats of a takeover. They emphasised that Arctic security as a key Nato priority, asserting that any decisions regarding Greenland must be made collectively by Denmark and Greenland, respecting sovereignty and international law.

title: Apple execs book long stays in S Korea — driven by Samsung and SK Hynix talks
content: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: Russia oil trade: India imported €144bn worth of crude since start of Ukraine war
content: India has emerged as Russia's second-largest crude oil buyer, importing approximately 144 billion euros since the Ukraine war began. This surge followed Western nations' reduced imports, significantly boosting Russia's fossil fuel earnings. While India's purchases have recently dipped due to fresh sanctions, the trend highlights a major shift in global energy trade dynamics.

title: 'Political vengeance': Chargesheet names 17 in Hadi murder case; links it to Hasina's party
content: Dhaka Metropolitan Police has filed a chargesheet naming 17 individuals in the killing of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, attributing the murder to "political vengeance." Hadi, a prominent figure in recent mass protests, was shot in December and died later. The investigation points to the Awami League and its student wing, Chhatra League, as being involved.

title: 'Should not permit illegality to be perpetuated': Bombay HC halts MCA election
content: The order was passed on a group of petitions alleging that Supreme Court norms governing sports body elections were violated and that favouritism was shown while adding names to the voters’ list released on December 25, 2025. The petitioners, including former India cricketer Kedar Jadhav, claimed that several of the newly inducted members had no link with cricket.

title: Math genius Joel David Hamkins says AI models are basically useless for math tasks
content: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: Civic wars 2026: Thackerays reunite, alliances shift — Maharashtra's BMC power game explained
content: Maharashtra gears up for crucial local body elections on January 15, marking the first electoral test of 2026. These polls, delayed by legal battles, will see alliances like the Mahayuti and Maha Vikas Aghadi vying for control of key urban centers, including the financially significant Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation.

title: SA20: At 39, Sikandar Raza still breaking new ground — for himself and Zimbabwe
content: From a winding journey that began in Sialkot to creating history in the SA20, Sikandar Raza’s career is a testament to resilience and reinvention. Overcoming personal tragedy, health scares and early international struggles, the Zimbabwe all-rounder has emerged as a global T20 freelancer, hoping his trailblazing path inspires the next generation of cricketers back home.

title: Gold outlook 2026: Yellow metal may see short-term moderation after stellar rally
content: Gold prices might pause in 2026 after a strong rally. Analysts predict a bullish long-term outlook.  US Federal Reserve rate cuts and global debt concerns will keep gold attractive.  Prices are unlikely to fall significantly.  Central bank buying and inflation fears provide strong support. Gold's role as a safe haven is expected to continue.

title: Belgium: Cybersecurity chief urges EU to cut US tech dependency, calls for digital sovereignty
content: Europe faces a "huge security problem" due to its deep reliance on American tech giants for digital infrastructure, warns Belgium's cybersecurity chief. He states Europe has "lost the internet" and cannot guarantee data stays within the EU. This dependence hinders innovation and leaves the continent vulnerable to cyber threats, necessitating a push for European digital sovereignty.

title: Delhi riots case: SC placed Khalid, Sharjeel on 'different footing'; what chargesheet said
content: The Supreme Court placed Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam on a ‘different footing' from others while denying bail, citing Delhi Police's evidence.  In their chargesheet, police accused Khalid as the central figure and Imam as his protégé, presenting phone calls, speech clips, and witness statements as proof of their alleged coordination of violence.

title: CBSE rolls out psycho-social counselling support for Board aspirants
content: Facing upcoming Class X and XII board exams, CBSE has launched free psycho-social counselling services until June 1. Students can access a 24/7 toll-free IVRS for guidance on stress and preparation. Weekdays offer tele-counselling with 73 trained professionals, including international experts. Digital resources on stress management are also available online, promoting emotional well-being for confident exam approaches.

title: 'People died in front of me': Indian recalls Bondi beach attack; was meters away from gunmen
content: An Uber driver, Rahemath Pasha, recounted his harrowing experience during the Bondi Beach mass shooting on December 14. Despite his fear, he chose to help an elderly woman and others, demonstrating profound humanity amidst the violence. His actions highlight courage and compassion in the face of tragedy.

title: SC: Fearless judges bedrock of judiciary, can’t be penalised for error of judgment
content: The Supreme Court ruled that judges cannot face disciplinary action for errors in judgment, emphasizing that a fearless judiciary is crucial for the rule of law. The court expressed concern over frivolous complaints against judges, which can lead to trial court judges hesitating to grant bail, and reinstated a judge terminated for an error in judgment.

title: Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' censor row: Madras HC questions release date; postpones hearing
content: Thalapathy Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan' faces a censor row. The Madras High Court questioned the January 9 release date. The court postponed the hearing to January 7. Producers stated the film is eligible for a U/A certificate. The delay is administrative. The court directed a formal complaint filing regarding religious sentiments. The film's release remains uncertain.

title: Snow, Kangris and Pherans: How Kashmir adapts to the rhythm of Chillai Kalan — inside the 40-day spell
content: Kashmir's harshest winter period, Chillai Kalan, has arrived, transforming the valley into a snow-draped spectacle. This year, the region is experiencing a remarkable surge in tourism, with hotels fully booked and events planned across popular destinations. The season also brings vital snowfall for agriculture and refuge for migratory birds, while the Army maintains a proactive counter-terror posture.

title: 'Failing to do its duty': SC raps pollution body over Delhi air; orders to submit expert report
content: The Supreme Court has criticized the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) for its inaction on Delhi's worsening air quality, which remains in the 'poor' category. The court has directed the CAQM to convene an expert meeting within two weeks to identify pollution causes and long-term solutions, rejecting a request for a two-month adjournment on key measures.

title: 'EC using BJP-developed app for SIR': Mamata levels fresh charge; calls exercise 'illegal'
content: Mamata Banerjee also accused the EC of adopting what she described as "wrong, unconstitutional and undemocratic" methods in carrying out the revision exercise ahead of assembly elections. The TMC supremo’s fresh set of allegations against the poll panel was made on a day when her party MP Derek O’Brien moved the Supreme Court against the EC, claiming it has taken recourse to “arbitrary and procedurally irregular actions” for conducting the ongoing SIR in West Bengal.

title: Uttarakhand: Govt mulls banning non-Hindus’ entry in 105 ghats of Haridwar; 1916 agreement in focus
content: Uttarakhand government is considering a ban on non-Hindus entering Haridwar's 105 ghats, potentially restoring a 1916 agreement. The state also plans to declare Haridwar and Rishikesh as 'holy cities'. This move follows demands from some religious leaders, though opposition exists among residents and former Ganga Sabha officials.

title: India issues travel advisory for Venezuela; shares emergency helpline details
content: India has issued a travel advisory urging citizens to avoid non-essential travel to Venezuela due to escalating tensions and volatility. This follows similar high-level warnings from the US, Canada, and Australia, highlighting significant security and humanitarian concerns, including crime, political instability, and shortages of essential goods.

title: On this day: Chappell, Lillee & Rod Marsh retired together at SCG
content: On January 6, 1984, Australian cricket legends Greg Chappell, Dennis Lillee, and Rod Marsh played their final Test together at the SCG. Chappell retired as Australia's highest run-scorer, Lillee as the world's leading wicket-taker, and Marsh with a then-world record for dismissals. Their simultaneous farewell marked the end of a golden era.

title: 'He chose the easiest format': Manjrekar blasts Kohli's Test retirement - Watch
content: Sanjay Manjrekar expressed disappointment over Virat Kohli's Test retirement, especially after Joe Root's recent century. He believes Kohli should have fought harder to overcome his lean patch in red-ball cricket, finding his decision to continue in ODIs more perplexing. Manjrekar feels Kohli's fitness suggested a comeback was possible, lamenting the loss of a great Test player.

title: China–Japan row: Beijing bans exports of dual-use goods to Tokyo amid Taiwan tensions
content: China has banned exports of dual-use goods to Japan, citing national security concerns amid heightened tensions over Taiwan. The move prohibits items that could enhance Japan's military power, with Beijing warning of legal consequences for violations. This action follows recent critical remarks from Japan regarding potential military intervention in the Taiwan Strait.

title: Alex Jones mocks Candace Owens over Zodiac Killer father claim apology
content: Alex Jones mocked claims made by Candace Owens’ source, Mitch Snow, who said the Zodiac Killer was his father. Jones used sarcasm to question the lack of proof and compared the claim to seeing Martians. Authorities have never identified the Zodiac Killer, and no DNA evidence has confirmed Snow’s story.

title: India’s first hydrogen train enters final stage; launch expected soon - key features
content: Haryana is preparing for India's first hydrogen-powered train. The pilot project on the Jind to Sonipat route is in its final stages. A dedicated hydrogen plant is ready to fuel the train. This advanced train will offer a longer travel distance and a silent, comfortable journey for passengers. Preparations are complete, awaiting the final launch date from higher authorities.

title: 6,6,6,4,6,6: Bairstow unleashes carnage in Centurion; Maharaj endures costliest SA20 over
content: Jonny Bairstow produced a moment of SA20 history at Centurion, smashing Keshav Maharaj for a record 34-run over that turned the contest decisively in Sunrisers Eastern Cape’s favour. While Bairstow flirted with the rare feat of six sixes in an over, Pretoria Capitals were left to reflect on another home defeat.

title: Reliance Industries shares fall 5%! Over Rs 1 lakh cr eroded from M-cap
content: Reliance Industries shares plummeted 5% after denying a Bloomberg report about receiving Russian crude oil. The company stated its Jamnagar refinery has not received Russian oil in three weeks and expects none in January, calling the report untrue and damaging. Despite the clarification, investor sentiment remained weak, impacting the Nifty 50.

title: 'We bitterly regret this': Swiss authorities admit inspection failure after Crans-Montana bar fire
content: Swiss local authorities admitted to a five-year lapse in safety inspections at a bar where a deadly New Year's Eve fire killed 40 people. Mayor Nicolas Feraud expressed deep regret for the oversight, stating "we bitterly regret this." Prosecutors are investigating the bar's managers following the blaze, which is believed to have been ignited by sparkling candles.

title: UP SIR: 2.89 cr voters removed from draft electoral roll; 46.23 lakh declared dead
content: Uttar Pradesh's draft electoral roll, published after a special intensive revision, has excluded approximately 2.89 crore voters. This exclusion is due to deceased voters, those who have moved or are missing, and duplicate entries. The final voter list will be released on March 6, 2026, with voters urged to verify their details online.

title: Indian economy may grow 6.9% in FY27; ‘Goldilocks’ phase likely to continue
content: India's economy is projected to grow by 6.9% in FY27, driven by structural reforms and trade agreements, according to India Ratings & Research. The nation anticipates a "Goldilocks" phase with strong growth and moderate inflation, averaging 3.8% for retail inflation. Government finances are also expected to improve, with Centre's debt easing to 55.5% of GDP.

title: Kota burglary attempt fails after thief gets trapped in exhaust fan window
content: A burglary attempt in Kota took a comical turn when one of two thieves got stuck in an exhaust fan window. The homeowner spotted the trapped intruder, leading to his arrest by police. His accomplice fled the scene. Authorities recovered a car key and a suspicious vehicle, suggesting a pattern of thefts. Efforts are ongoing to nab the second suspect.

title: ‘Drinking habit irked girlfriend’: South Korean man stabbed to death in Noida
content: A romantic Saturday evening turned tragic in Noida when a live-in partner allegedly stabbed his South Korean boyfriend to death after an argument over his drinking habits. The 22-year-old woman claimed self-defense after her partner threatened her. She later admitted to the stabbing, leading to her arrest and judicial custody.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection day 33: Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna starrer begins to slow down
content: Dhurandhar continues its record-breaking run, surpassing 'Pushpa 2' to become the highest-grossing Hindi film ever. Despite a slight slowdown after the holiday window, the Ranveer Singh starrer has amassed an impressive Rs 777.78 crore. This non-sequel hit now sets its sights on outperforming 'Pushpa 2' in future installments.

title: Sidney Crosby’s lifestyle: Inside Penguins captain’s luxury watch collection
content: Sidney Crosby is the player whom the world recognizes as one of the most impressive NHL players of his time. Other than his incredible success on the ice, Crosby has also acquired a taste for pure luxury watches. His assortment demonstrates performance, style, and an individual meaning and reveals his personality off the ice and an increasing engagement with the Swiss watch industry.

title: Riteish Deshmukh hits back at BJP chief’s ‘wiped out’ remark on father
content: Riteish Deshmukh emotionally responded to Maharashtra BJP president Ravindra Chavan's claim that his late father, Vilasrao Deshmukh's legacy would be erased from Latur. The actor stated that leaders who served the people live on in public memory, beyond political erasure. Chavan's remarks were made at an election rally, predicting the end of Vilasrao Deshmukh's influence in the city.

title: 'Donald Jennifer Trump': Jimmy Kimmel trolls president in Critics Choice win speech - watch
content: Jimmy Kimmel playfully thanked "Donald Jennifer Trump" after winning a Critics Choice Award, crediting the former president's "ridiculous things" for his show's success.  This comes after a public feud and FCC threats that ironically boosted Kimmel's ratings. He also lauded industry support for free speech.

title: Hajj 2026 shock: Why has Egypt ended free pilgrimage trips? New rules, packages introduced
content: Egypt is ending state-funded free Hajj slots for 2026, shifting to a digital lottery for approximately 12,000 pilgrims and licensed paid packages. This move reflects economic reforms and aims for transparency in managing the pilgrimage. Ordinary Egyptians will now rely on these new systems rather than government subsidies for their spiritual journey.

title: "Come Get Me": Colombian President Dares Trump The Same Way Maduro Did
content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro has challenged US President Donald Trump in the aftermath of a United States operation in Venezuela. Petro slammed the operation on Monday and, in a statement to Trump, said, "Come get me. I'm waiting for you here."

title: Opinion: Opinion | China's "Core Interests": What It Means, And Why Arunachal Is Now A Part Of It
content: India should be cautious of the possibility of China's new 'low-risk-high-returns' approach towards the border: delegitimising the nationality of Indian travellers from Arunachal and the use of proxy actors acting at its behest.

title: Minor Beats Grandmother To Death Over 'Witchcraft' Suspicion In Bengal: Cops
content: A minor grandson has been detained on charges of murdering his elderly grandmother on suspicion of practising witchcraft, police said on Monday.

title: 'Image Damaged': Court's Criminal Liability Warning Over Indore Water Deaths
content: The Indore Bench of the Madhya Pradesh High Court on Tuesday came down heavily on the state government and the Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) over the contaminated water crisis.

title: Hemant Soren Steps In After Clearance Delay For Abhishek Banerjee's Chopper
content: Trinamool Congress national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee reached Rampurhat in Bengal's Birbhum later than scheduled for a public rally on Tuesday, after flight clearance for his helicopter was delayed.

title: Catch Salahuddin: Inspired By US Action In Venezuela, PoK Refugees' Appeal To PM
content: Displaced individuals from Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir have called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi to launch a bold and decisive strike against terror infrastructure in the region. Their ideas are inspired by the recent US operation in Venezuela.

title: 'So Many Applications Don't Come For Humans': Top Court On Stray Dogs Case
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday took note of the number of interlocutory applications being filed before it in the stray dogs case and said that so many applications normally don't come even in cases of humans.

title: Metro Official, Family Killed In Fire At Flat In Delhi
content: A Delhi Metro Rail Corporation official and two members of his family died in a fire at their residence in northwest Delhi's Adarsh Nagar in the early hours of Tuesday, officials said.

title: Sadhu Claiming To Be Standing For 7 Years Draws Attention At Magh Mela
content: Amid rows of ash-smeared ascetics and chanting devotees at Magh Mela here, a 26-year-old sadhu is drawing quiet but steady attention for an unusual spiritual vow -" he claims he has not sat or lain down for the past seven years.

title: Central Pollution Body Pulled Up By Supreme Court Over Tardiness, Adjournment
content: The Commission for Air Quality Management or CAQM, was strongly reprimanded by the Supreme Court today, which said the pollution body was not taking the issues raised by the court seriously.

title: Communities In Manipur Cutting Across Ethnic Lines Seek End To Attacks
content: Civil society organisations of communities cutting across ethnic lines in Manipur have asked the government to ensure attacks on civilians are stopped in the border state, where thousands of central security force personnel have been deployed.

title: 25 Killed, Over 1,000 Arrested In Iran's Economic Protests: Rights Groups
content: At least 25 people have been killed in Iran during the first nine days of protests that started in the bazaar of Tehran over the plunging value of the currency and soaring inflation, according to rights groups.

title: 2.89 Crore Voters Removed From UP SIR Draft List, Maximum From Lucknow
content: Releasing the draft revised list for Uttar Pradesh after the Special Intensive Revision (SIR), the Election Commission said 2.89 crore voters have been removed from the electoral rolls in the state, including 46 lakh voters who are dead.

title: 4 Killed, Many Injured After Vehicle Carrying 40 Falls Into Gorge In Manipur
content: Four people, including three women, were killed and many injured after a pickup van fell off a hilly road in Manipur's Churachandpur on Tuesday.

title: In US Lobbying Firm's Filings, No Mention Of Trump Mediating In Op Sindoor
content: Newly examined US public disclosures have cast fresh doubt on former President Donald Trump's repeated assertions that Washington brokered a ceasefire between India and Pakistan during Operation Sindoor in May last year.

title: "Makes World Less Safe": UN Slams US Intervention In Venezuela
content: The world community must make clear that US intervention in Venezuela is a violation of international law that makes the world less safe, the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights said on Tuesday.

title: Can't Erase My Dad's Name: Riteish Deshmukh On BJP Leader's Remarks
content: Maharashtra BJP chief Ravindra Chavan on Tuesday apologised for his remarks on Vilasrao Deshmukh, after an emotional response from the former chief minister's son and Bollywood actor Riteish Deshmukh.

title: Man Wears Wig To Look Different, Marries, Then Blackmails Wife In Greater Noida
content: A man in Greater Noida has been accused of deceiving a woman after he hid his baldness with a wig and later harassed and blackmailed her for money.

title: Congress' Poll Strategy - Use Pinarayi Vijayan's "Get Out" Remark Against Him
content: The Congress party has decided to turn Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's controversial "Kadakku Purathu" (Get Out) remark into a sharp election slogan against the ruling Left in the lead-up to the 2026 Kerala Assembly polls, according to sources.

title: Supreme Court Gives Centre 4 Months To Decide On EPF Wage Ceiling
content: The Supreme Court on Monday directed the Central government and the Employees Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) to decide, within four months, on revising the wage ceiling under the Employees Provident Fund Scheme (EPFS)

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: ‘I was a minor’: Indonesian model says she was forced to marry Malaysian prince
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: 'Bing Bong': Detroit Pistons troll New York Knicks after big win
content: the Pistons beat the new york Knicks 121-90 on monday . the win marks the fourth-largest regular-season victory over new york in franchise history . they wrote "Bing Bong" in their postgame caption .

title: Divisional rankings: Nakatani makes debut at 122 pounds
content: the end of 2025 saw some movement as a former heavyweight champion made his way back into the rankings . a future opponent wasn't quite as impressive in his divisional debut . "The Gypsy King" announced his return to the ring .

title: What does Pete Carroll's exit mean for the Raiders, Geno Smith?
content: Pete Carroll led the Raiders to a 3-14 record -- his worst as a coach . the 74-year-old was fired on monday with 17 games into his three-year deal . he was "blindly optimistic" about the talent on the roster .

title: 2026 Unrivaled megapreview: Rosters, rankings, rules, how to watch
content: 54 of the league's top players are in Miami as the second season of unrivaled tips off . the 3-on-3 league was created to give players a domestic offseason playing opportunity . each member of this season's championship team will win an additional $100,000 .

title: Ranking the best QBs in the transfer portal
content: ESPN's rankings of the top quarterbacks in the transfer portal . the most coveted passers on the board are quickly locking in decisions on their next stop . a year later, it's Indiana, Oregon, Ole Miss and Miami in the college football playoff semifinals .

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the first rankings of 2026 came with plenty of change after the LSU Tigers , Maryland Terrapins and Iowa State Cyclones all lost . ranked no. 5, 6, 7, 8 and 10 from the previous poll all lost in the last four days .

title: JNU seeks FIR against students over anti-Modi, Shah slogans during protest
content: Sugandha Jha is a journalist with over half a decade of experience covering education, social affairs, and current news. With a sharp eye for numbers and a strong grounding in data-driven reporting, she brings clarity and insight to complex issues. Beyond the newsroom, she’s passionate about exploring regional cuisine and the stories behind what we eat. Her work blends analytical rigour with human interest, offering readers nuanced perspectives across diverse subjects. Read More

title: Offseason grades: Blue Jays make another splash by signing Japanese 3B Okamoto
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: four years, $60 million Grade: C+ Kazuma Okamoto and the Toronto Blue Jays came to an agreement one day before the end of his posting window .

title: Early wild card bets: How to bet Packers-Bears, Bills-Jaguars
content: the playoffs kick off with the Los Angeles Rams at the Carolina Panthers, followed by the Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears . on Sunday, the red-hot Houston Texans hit the road to face the Pittsburgh Steelers .

title: 'Not even in human cases': SC observes surge in pleas over stray dogs case; hearing on Wednesday

title: The playoffs are here! Our guide to all 14 teams, from favorites to underdogs
content: the playoffs for the 2025 season's playoffs are set after the Steelers beat the Ravens in a season-ending classic . the team will face each other during wild-card weekend . each of the 14 playoff teams needs to do to reach the super Bowl .

title: What explains inconsistencies in deciding bail pleas in recent past
content: a court cannot treat liberty of an accused as the sole criterion and societal security as peripheral . the case relates to protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act turning violent, leading to communal clashes during the visit of US President Trump in 2020 .

title: Why Man United sacked Ruben Amorim: Basic tactics, player issues, transfer frustration
content: manchester united sacking Ruben Amorim after 14 months at the club . the club's style of play "will be determined in this room," says sir Jim Ratcliffe . he was told that hiring amorim was a risk; he warned that reshaping the squad would take millions .

title: From No. 1 to nowhere: Ranking the biggest disasters of the 2025 season
content: Penn State coach Terry Smith is showered with grass clippings after the win over Clemson . the teams most disappointed with how 2025 played out, loosely ranked in eight categories . four preseason top-ranked teams are most disappointed . a team that has won a title in the past 24 years has lost a season .

title: Pistons, Knicks and big questions along the race for the East's top seed
content: the new york Knicks and Detroit Pistons face off as the top two seeds in the Eastern Conference . the two teams have ramped-up expectations for the first time since the series . they are the newly crowned NBA Cup champions, led by the steady Brunson .

title: Nathan MacKinnon vs. Macklin Celebrini for MVP?
content: Connor McDavid won the past two Selke Trophies as the NHL's best defensive forward . he has yet to play a game this season after a preseason injury required knee surgery . the 19-year-old has announced his arrival among the league's superstars and in the MVP race .

title: Congress celebrates Siddaramaiah’s record
content: MLA Channareddy Patil Tunnur addresses a gathering after launching celebrations to mark the occasion in his office in Yadgir

title: Crop failure in Guatemala boosts India’s Cardamom exports
content: Drop in production of the crop in the Central American nation has become a boon for exporters from India; Kerala has seen an increase in yield of the spice this year

title: Leprosy cases on the rise in Kasaragod with 32 people under treatment
content: Health officials attribute resurgence to a decline in vigilance under the leprosy eradication programme, after cases dropped sharply following intensive intervention in the mid-2000s, and increased migration.  Health department will conduct a two-week door-to-door survey from January 7 as part of the ‘Aswamedham 7.0’ campaign under the slogan “Let’s check the patches, protect health

title: ₹34.71 cr. revenue from petroleum loading at IOCL Pakni siding
content: A total of 243 rakes carrying petroleum products were loaded from IOCL Pakni siding between January and December 2025

title: Thrissur ready to host 64th State School Arts Festival from January 14
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to inaugurate five-day cultural extravaganza featuring 249 events across 25 venues

title: As of now, there is no question of leadership change: Satish Jarkiholi
content: Stating that confusions are common in political parties, the Minister says Siddaramaiah will continue to be CM and go on to complete his term

title: Rayaraddi hails Siddaramaiah for a milestone in his tenure as CM
content: The Yelburga MLA describes it as a moment of pride for Karnataka’s tradition of social justice and people-centric governance

title: Kanjirappally gears up for a political showdown
content: The UDF aims at reclaiming the seat lost to the LDF in the last election and is considering candidates like former legislator Joseph Vazhackan. Incumbent MLA N. Jayaraj of the LDF seeks to retain his seat, while the NDA also emerges as a strong contender.

title: Construction firm attempting Guinness World Records via Puttaparthi NH project
content: Firm has set a target to construct a continuous 52-km bituminous stretch over seven days without interruption, says Raj Path Infracon Private Limited

title: Vigilance probe launched into missing ghee packets at Sabarimala
content: As many as 16,000 packets of ghee, valued at around ₹16 lakh, which were handed over to the distribution counter, are reported to be missing

title: A.P. SIPB approves investment proposals worth ₹19,391 crore
content: Projects proposed by 14 companies are expected to generate jobs for 11,753 people; CM announces master plan for development of Suryalanka Beach

title: Special squads to monitor 45 sensitive centres during Intermediate exams in Andhra Pradesh, says official
content: Human Values and Ethics and Environmental Education exams for first-year Intermediate students scheduled on January 21 and 23

title: SC agrees to take up plea for SOP on freezing, de-freezing bank accounts in cybercrime cases
content: The plea also sought appropriate guidelines to all investigating agencies, including cyber cells, to ensure no bank account gets frozen without a written order and intimation to the account holder within 24 hours of such action

title: Ex-Advisor to MoJS blames both Congress, BRS for Telangana’s river water woes
content: Alleges that the two parties have failed to build infrastructure to utilise river waters, allowed Andhra to take away more water

title: KSHRC chairman meets victims of honour killing at Inam Veerapur
content: T. Shyam Bhat says the issue will be treated with utmost seriousness and strict legal action will be recommended against those responsible for it

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Haryana Police arrest man for ‘spying’ on Ambala Air Force Station for Pakistan
content: Accused Sunil Kumar had been in contact with a woman on a Pakistani social media platform for the past seven months, officials said.

title: Lokayukta directs Kalaburagi officials to allot land for ex-servicemen on priority
content: Clear pending applications, B.S. Patil says and adds that those who served the nation should not face undue delays

title: Own goal? Pakistan admits political-criminal-terror nexus on its soil; report flags rising violence
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: Doctor shortage, poor emergency care crippling Hyderabad government hospitals, says HRF
content: Representation addressed to Chief Minister highlights urgent need to increase bed capacity in the hospitals, noting that several medical equipment is either faulty, under prolonged repair or in need of complete replacement

title: Maths paper of II PU preparatory exam allegedly leaked in Shivamogga, leaves officers in shock
content: Officers of the Department of School Education (PU) learnt on January 6 that the question paper which the students were answering was leaked ahead of the examination and was circulated among students.

title: Himachal’s Kangra administration bans trekking above 3,000 metres
content: Kangra Deputy Commissioner Hemraj Bairwa said that orders regarding trekking are issued from time to time, keeping in mind the safety of tourists

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor trouble: Madras High Court to take a call on actor Vijay’s movie release
content: Justice P.T. Asha directs Central Board of Film Certification to submit all records including a complaint received against the movie

title: Telangana Govt deployed mobile App for timely supply of fertilisers to farmers: Agriculture Minister
content: Tummala Nageswara Rao says urea shortage last kharif was due to delayed supply and shut down of Ramagundam Fertilisers and Chemicals Limited  during peak season

title: Court grants more time to Sonia Gandhi to file response on plea over inclusion of her name in electoral roll
content: Gandhi sought more time to file the response following which the court granted time till February 7, the next date of hearing

title: Hoax bomb threat email to Passport Office in Bengaluru
content: Following the threat message, personnel from bomb disposal squad and police teams rushed to the spot and carried out a thorough inspection of the premises and surrounding areas.

title: HC directs Madhya Pradesh chief secretary to appear over Indore water contamination issue
content: The HC termed the response of the State government and local administration to the crisis as "insensitive"; the court would examine whether the matter involved criminal liability or civil liability, one of the petitioners said

title: Agrileaf develops AI driven technology to grade, sort out arecanut
content: Leaders of cooperative bodies dealing with arecanut visited Agrileaf at Nidle in Dakshina Kannada on January 5 and witnessed the application of technology.

title: Electronics City police recover 48 laptops stolen from PGs
content: One of the accused is a laptop service technician, who would format the stolen laptops and refurbish them before selling them in the grey market for financial gain.

title: Interim bail for journalist Mahesh Langa to continue, Supreme Court says
content: Appearing before a Bench headed by the Chief Justice of India, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, for the Enforcement Directorate, said the trial was likely to be concluded in three months

title: TMC MP files application in Supreme Court alleging procedural irregularities in SIR in West Bengal
content: The application has sought a direction to the ECI to extend the deadline for submitting claims and objections.

title: Thirupparankundram row: T.N. government to appeal in Supreme Court against Madras HC order, says Minister Regupathy
content: The DMK Minister said there was no evidence to show that the practice of lighting lamp at a stone pillar near the dargah on the Thirupparankundram hill during ‘Karthigai Deepam’ had ever existed, at least in the last 100 years.

title: CAQM failing in its duty: SC after pollution watchdog seeks two-month adjournment on toll plaza issue
content: Supreme Court directed the Commission of Air Quality Management (CAQM) to convene a meeting of experts in two weeks and submit a report on major causes of the worsening pollution

title: Confident of completing full term, but decision left to high command, asserts Siddaramaiah
content: Expressing satisfaction over his long political career, Mr. Siddaramaiah said working for the people gives him happiness.

title: Parvatipuram Collector launches Helping Hands programme in hospitals
content: As part of the programme volunteers at the help desks will guide tribal patients and others in meeting the doctors concerned and get other services

title: V.K. Ebrahim Kunju, IUML leader and former Kerala Minister, passes away
content: A four-time member of Kerala Assembly, Ebrahim Kunju represented Kalamassery constituency in Ernakulam from 2011 to 2021. He was also MLA of then Mattancherry constituency from 2001 to 2011

title: Uttar Pradesh SIR: ECI releases draft voter list; over 2.8 crore names deleted
content: 12.55 crore names were retained in the list; 2.89 crore names were deleted due to deaths, permanent migration or multiple registrations

title: Paddy procurement going on smoothly, says Nadendla Manohar
content: The government had allocated around ₹14,000 crore for paddy procurement in the State and supplied adequate number of gunny bags and tarpaulins to all districts, the Minister for Civil Supplies said

title: Dubai-bound SpiceJet flight delay strands 180 passengers at Calicut airport in Kerala
content: The flight, originally scheduled to depart at 11:50 p.m. on Monday, was postponed until Tuesday morning. After the passengers were relocated to a hotel for the night, the flight was further delayed to 10:30 a.m. on Tuesday. Airline officials attributed the disruption to ‘a technical issue’

title: T.N. Deputy CM Udhayanidhi flags off fleet of 61 new buses for SETC
content: The new buses will join the fleet of services being operated by the SETC from Chennai to various parts of Tamil Nadu, as well as to major cities in neighbouring States such as Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Kerala.

title: ₹24-crore hawala, GST fraud racket busted in Bareilly, two held
content: “Racket surfaced after a small zari (embroidery) artisan received an income tax notice of nearly ₹1.5 crore for transactions he was unaware of,” says Bareilly Superintendent of Police

title: Ex-lekhpal, family held at gunpoint in Uttar Pradesh home; jewellery, cash worth over ₹50 lakh robbed
content: An FIR has been registered against unknown persons, and police teams are scanning CCTV footage from the area to identify the suspects, who are believed to be in their early 20s

title: ECI illegally using mobile apps developed by BJP’s IT cell to conduct SIR, alleges Mamata
content: Mamata Banerjee’s allegations against the ECI was made on a day when her party MP Derek O’Brien moved the Supreme Court against the ECI

title: High Court stays Maharashtra Cricket Association election
content: Order came on a bunch of petitions claiming that norms laid down by the Supreme Court for the elections were violated, and there was favouritism in adding members to the voters' list released on December 25, 2025

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR: Article 324 grants ECI control over preparing electoral rolls, argues Rakesh Dwivedi
content: Representing the ECI, Rakesh Dwivedi argues against the petitioners' claims that only the Centre can address the issue, citing Articles 324 and 327 of the Constitution that empower the Commission in electoral matters

title: Karur stampede case: CBI summons TVK leader Vijay to appear for questioning
content: Acting on the Supreme Court’s interim orders, a team of the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrived in Karur on October 17 to investigate the stampede

title: Thane jail inmate manhandles cop, smashes CCTV cameras; booked
content: The accused claimed he was "unfazed" by legal action because he had faced similar charges in the past

title: HC tells TTD to come up with fresh plan on Parakamani
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court gave liberty to the CID to take action against the police officers who are allegedly involved in the conspiracy (theft of foreign currency) as per the TTD report

title: Kalmadi: able administrator whose career ended with a ‘scam’
content: Congress leader Suresh Kalmadi was once a Railway Minister, and the president of the Indian Olympic Association from 1996 to 2012, but the 2010 Commonwealth Games scam damaged his reputation beyond repair

title: Indian Embassy hired Trump aide’s firm for talks on trade, Operation Sindoor, bilateral ties
content: According to FARA filings, lobby firm SHW was asked to schedule meetings for Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar, Foreign Secretary, and the Ambassador with U.S. Vice-President J.D. Vance, Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth, and CIA chief John Ratcliffe
